snippet: One day after a company unveiled an app allowing yellow-taxi drivers and passengers to find one another, the city said it had not authorized the use of smartphone apps for taxi-hailing or payment.
abstract: New York City issues a reminder that smartphone apps designed to hail taxicabs or make payments are not permitted under current regulations, one day after Uber unveils just such a mobile app; Taxi and Limousine Commission says devices run afoul of current contract guidelines, but that rules could be updated, after contract expires in February 2013, to accommodate a broader use of such mobile applications.
lead_paragraph: One day after a company unveiled an app allowing yellow-taxi drivers and passengers to find one another, the city said it had not authorized the use of smartphone apps for taxi-hailing or payment.

headline.seo: Cab-Hailing Apps Not Allowed by New York Taxi Commission
headline.main: For Now, Taxi Office Says, Cab-Hailing Apps Aren’t Allowed
